body.name: ArtCreativity Light Up Transparent Toy Cars for Kids, Set of 2, Bump and Go Toy Cars with Colorful Moving Gears, Music, and LED Effects, Fun Educational Toy for Kids, Great Birthday Gift Idea
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Friday, February 23 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Tuesday, February 20. Order within 9 hrs 49 mins
features: FUEL THE EXCITEMENT: A car toy that takes fun to fast and furious extremes! This transparent toy car for kids is crammed with features. It lights up, it plays music, it moves on its own, and it even has colorful gears that turn in spectacular style for hours of fun.

BUMP N’ GO MECHANISM: Little race car lovers will be transfixed with excitement as they observe the coolness. Each time this light-up car toy hits a barrier, it automatically changes direction and keeps cruising; all thanks to the cool bump and go action engine.

LEARNING MADE FUN: Spark a love for science and mechanics with the cool spinning gear motion. We’ve also designed the on/off button with 3 gears to match any playtime mood. The first keeps the car off, the second turns on the lights only, and the third triggers the car to start moving with the lights on.

GREAT GIFT IDEA: Birthday, holiday, or anything in between, this bump and go toy car for boys and girls make a memorable treat. You’ll love the high-quality plastic that withstands all the action. Also great as a game prize or gift shop item. For kids 3+

NO SIBLING RIVALRY: Less fighting, more fun! Every set comes with 2 gear cars for kids – 1 basic & 1 racer car. This means everyone can get in on the action and reap nothing but smiles. Feel free to get in on the fun for some quality hangout time.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Kid loves it, mom hates it, check for sharp edges before use
reviews.reviewText: My kids love their transparent gear train, so I thought that I'd get them these. First thing I do when I receive a new toy is check for sharp edges. These came set of 2, both cars have little sharp pieces that stick out and are dangerous for little fingers. There were a few spots where I needed to smooth out with a nail file. The stickers that go on the cars are next to impossible to remove without tearing to pieces, which essentially renders them useless, but I'd gladly take stubborn stickers over the obnoxiously loud music. There is no way to turn the music down. I ended up putting layers of tape on the speaker vent which made it slightly more tolerable. Gear was also misnumbered 1-2-3-5(?!). Otherwise, the kiddos love the visual stimulation, the noise and bump and go design.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Reminds me of my phone from the 90’s
reviews.reviewText: My boys love these cars. They are interesting to look at and play with
